intro: Escobariopsis aureilanata, commonly known as the golden flake lichen, is a foliose lichen belonging to the family Pilocarpaceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange thallus, which is often covered with a fine, powdery layer ofaleurone. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on bark or soil in temperate regions. It has a slow growth rate and is often used as an indicator species for air quality due to its sensitivity to pollution. Its unique coloration and structure make it a distinctive member of the lichen community.
